intro: Conyza laeta, commonly known as the whiteleaf fleabane, is an annual flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped, gray-green leaves. Its flowers bloom in the summer months, producing white to pale yellow petals that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Conyza laeta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
